TopicTitle: FanWork Fridays: Let Them Eat Cake!

Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/301cb0bc17ca76a396dc75e2651dee4d/tumblr_inline_n4m2knysNZ1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/de280cc9638c229719a884120a4f69e6/tumblr_inline_n4m2zcPn8B1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p>We’re big cake fans here at <strong>Squad</strong>. We’re just as amazed at the amount of creativity some of you have been able to accomplish with cake, as we are with your in-game creations. It’s too bad we can’t eat your ships, only the Kraken. <strong>Kelly W</strong> made this <em><strong>KSP</strong></em> cake for her boyfriend’s birthday. We hope there were no explosions he ate it.</p>
Delicious! I'm wondering though, if Minmus is mint, what flavor is Mun?

Schweet!

This is seriously awesome... are the kerbals, command pods, and rocket parts made out of marzipan?

Edited July 6, 2014 by Woopert
I prefer my kakes to be SRB flavored. They have a nasty kick to them, but I can handle it.
This cake looks delicious... and it's perfectly timed for my birthday!
Hmm cool cake... though not sure the quote that is used to justify the French revolution and the subsequent reign of terror, is really a great choice for a title.
Does anyone know how that's done? What are the ingredients? How do you construct things like that?

Is that cake rocketfuel-flavored?

Liquid Hydrogen and Liquid Oxygen fuel would taste like water (since it is ) after being burned!

Does anyone know how that's done? What are the ingredients? How do you construct things like that?

I'm thinking marzipan for the Kerbals, and just though of this: perhaps Twinkies for the rocket parts?

Hmm cool cake... though not sure the quote that is used to justify the French revolution and the subsequent reign of terror, is really a great choice for a title.

You're right. It was the first thing that came to mind and I really wanted cake when I wrote that.
